title.narrative: Grenada - Caribbean Regional Air Transport Connectivity

Actual start date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

description.narrative: Total Disbursement in First Quarter of 2021
Total Commitment in Second Quarter of 2020

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall carry out the Project in accordance with the implementation arrangements set forth in Section I, Schedule 2 ofthe Financing Agreement (FA).

No later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date, the Recipient, through MOIID shall (a) designate a Project manager tomanage the implementation of the Project, including coordination and collaboration among MOIID, MOF, MOTCA, GAA, the Civil AviationDivision, and ECCAA, with qualifications, terms of reference, and under terms and conditions acceptable to the Association and asfurther described in the Operational Manual; and (b) designate an environmental and social specialist with qualifications, termsof reference, and under terms and conditions acceptable to the Association and as further described in the Operational Manual.(Schedule 2, Section I.A.2 of the FA)

The Recipient shall coordinate with the Eastern Caribbean Civil Aviation Authority (ECCAA) with respect to Project activitiesrelated to capacity building on air transport regulation and oversight. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.3 of the FA)

The Recipient, through the MOIID, shall operate and maintain throughout Project implementation: (a) a Project Oversight Committeeto monitor Project implementation and provide guidance on policy and institutional matters, with a composition and terms ofreference satisfactory to the Association, as further described in the Operational Manual; and (b) a Technical Advisory Committeeto assist with the technical oversight of the Project, with a composition and terms of reference satisfactory to the Association,as further described in the Operational Manual. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.4 of the FA)

No later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date, the Recipient, through MOIID shall enter into an implementation agreementwith GAA, under terms and conditions acceptable to the Association (“Implementation Agreement”), which shall include, inter alia,(a) the roles and responsibilities of GAA with regard to the implementation of the Project; and (b) the obligation of GAA to complywith the requirements applicable to the Project in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.5 ofthe FA)

The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association for its review and approval, a Contingency Emergency Response Manual(“CER Manual”) which shall set forth detailed implementation arrangements for the Emergency Response Part of the Project. (Schedule2, Section I.D.1 of the FA)

The Recipient shall, throughout the implementation of the Emergency Response Part of the Project, maintain the institutionalstructures and arrangements established in accordance with the CER Manual, with adequate staff and resources satisfactory to theAssociation. (Schedule 2, Section I.D.2 of the FA)

The Recipient shall undertake no activities under the Emergency Response Part of the Project unless: (a) the Recipient hasdetermined that an Eligible Crisis or Emergency has occurred, has furnished to the Association a request to include said activitiesand the Association has agreed; and (b) the Recipient has ensured the preparation and disclosure of all environmental and socialinstruments as may be required for said activities, the Association has approved all said instruments, and the Recipient hasensured the implementation of any actions which are required to be taken under said instruments. (Schedule 2, Section I.D.3 of theFA)

title.narrative: Modernization of air navigation systems and oversight
Annual passenger volume of MBIA (previous year)
Debt Service Coverage Ratio (DSCR) of Grenada Airport Authority (previous year)
Regional capacity building program on air traffic control and management prepared and endorsed
Air Cargo Facility certified as a trusted point of departure
Installation of Automatic Terminal Information Service (ATIS)
Installation of Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Broadcast (ADS-B)
Completion of gap analysis for GAA and civil aviation division
Installation of Precision Approach Path Indicator (PAPI)
Regional change in airspace area covered by globally standardized air traffic monitoring system
Percentage of Government staff trained on climate/disaster resilience
Share of women included in medium-skills training
Share of female air traffic controllers
Percentage of ATC staff trained on use of ADS-B and ILS installation and air traffic control services
Grievance received by the project staff that are addressed according to the agreed GRM procedures and the results communicated backto the involved stakeholders
Change in number of women hired for middle-skilled jobs by GAA
